content:
E.L PERIOD James might not be the only one ruling the erotica world soon PERIOD

Or at least thats what the coordinators of UTs  are hoping for Thursday at  Led by sex writer and columnist Sinclair Sexsmith the intensive workshop will analyze good and bad erotic writing followed by a reading from one of Sinclairs works PERIOD

DeAundra Blackwell open board seat for the organization said the event could benefit students by using basic principles for a usually taboo subject PERIOD

Blackwell a senior in psychology and minor in child and family studies said PERIOD 

Despite losing funding from the state  began Saturday March  with the staged reading of  at the Carousel Theatre PERIOD

With the popularity of the erotic  book series Blackwell said the novels offer an open atmosphere to discuss sensitive and perhaps embarrassing topics PERIOD Blackwell said such risqu novels are needed to push people passed their boundaries while still providing the basic story structure PERIOD

 Blackwell said PERIOD 

Mollie Belfus a sophomore in journalism and electronic media said she is a fan of the books although she has only read the first two of the trilogy PERIOD She said she enjoyed reading the novels because they were different from other works and sad erotic novels allow introspection and give light to a shade that people rarely show PERIOD

 Belfus said PERIOD 

The future on Belfus own debut sex piece seems probable PERIOD

 Belfus said chuckling PERIOD
